On 3.1 M7

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create Hello World RCP example
2. Create Feature based on Hello World plugin
3. Create Product 1, based on Hello World Plug-in
4. Export Product 1.  Product runs without error
5. Create Product 2, based on Hello World Feature
6. Product launches fine from the PDE
7. Export Product 2.  Product fails on launch with the following error

I've been testing this during the test pass and I did not see any problem.

Hello World Feature

You should also be able to re-create this problem by following the steps in the
original post.

I was able to get the example to work, although I would consider these steps to
be a workaround, and a clumsy one at that.  Maybe this isn't really a bug.  If
not, it sure is an odd way to go about creating an RCP app from a feature.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create Hello World RCP example
2. Create Feature based on Hello World plugin
3. Create Product 1, based on Hello World Plug-in
4. Export Product 1.  Product runs without error
5. Create Product 2, based on Hello World Feature
(here's the new steps)
6. Include all plug-ings and fragments listed on the product 1 configuration
page in the list of "plug-ins and fragment" on the "Plug-ins" page of the Hello
World Feature.  That is, make sure the two lists are exactly the same
7. Create product 2 based on the Hello World feature.
8. Export and run.  The application runs without error.

There are two problems that I see:
1. The "Add required plug-ins" on the configuration page of a product based on
plug-ins does not do the same thing as the "Compute" button on the dependencies
tab of feature.xml.  
2.  Even if the first problem were corrected (or a new button was added), you
still need to go through the process of moving the plug-ings from the
"Dependencies" to the "Plug-ins" tab on feature.xml.  I realize this is somewhat
of a special case since the feature IS the application.  I could export the
product based on plugins, but then I will run into problems when I try to use
the update manager to install new features.

I've attached the two projects that do not export correctly.

The attachement represents an invalid setup that can not even run in self host
mode. When I tried to start with RC1, it indicated that you were missing osgi.
This is normal since what you are trying to run does not include any of the
basic RCP plugins (osgi, swt, jface, etc). Indeed, your hellpworldfeature only
includes the helloworld plugin and does not refer to any other plugin or feature.

I'm moving to PDE UI, to see if something can be done to help those scenarios.

That's fine.  What didn't seem right to me was that I could create a working
product based on the plug-in (using the "add required plug-ins" button), but I
could not do the same if I started with a feature based on the plug-in.  

Is the process described in Comment #3 the suggested method of creating an RCP
app based on a feature?

I am moving to PDE/Doc to add to the 3.1 documentation an example of how to 
create a feature-based product.

we added a product section to the PDE guide for 3.1 explaining how to create a 
plugin based and a feature based product.
